attributes.action: intermediate health system for disabled children becoming adults
attributes.additional_details:
When children with physical and mental disabilities become adults their conditions are forgotten and are treated as having a normal adult disposition.
  When dealing with Consultant’s, Dr’s and nurses they then say they need  independence the deny them the right to make decisions about who treats them and who they want to care for them socially and medically.
   There should be a branch of the N.H.S. to facilitate the needs of these people.
The health charter states that the medical profession should listen to the patient and the parents of
the patient. Because in the end, these are the people who know their condition best.

The petition is that an intermediate health service for the children with physical and mental disabilities be setup with in the N.H.S. to cater for their specific needs and rights as a human being
And not given to bureaucratic expensive managerial waste but incorporated in the existing   Health
 Service.
